Html:
CLINQ'ers,

I'm sure you get asked this from time to time. Where should a veteran C# .NET LINQ developer begin as a C++/CLI CLINQ newbie?

Briefly, I've got some classes in a C++/CLI library that are exposing some IEnumerable<> results given a Dictionary<> backing field. I would like to ask a series of questions about that dictionary exposed through the enumerations. It seems CLINQ a strong viable approach to accomplishing this task?

Where might I find some documentation? Or I just downloaded the source itself as well. Or for some tutorials? Throughout Codeplex?

Thanks...

Best regards,

Michael

This primer looks like as good an introduction as any to demonstrate the issue. I think that basically unlocks what I need to do.

The Linq between C# and C++
I should also add, we're using Visual Studio 2008 / Visual C++ for its C++/CLI features (among other things). Which it seems CLINQ will support?
